entry.title: Python Scan network equipment
entry.content:
Python the paramiko module scans the in-network for the device.

Background

We are operating a big campus network, having many different vendor devices,
and building with different years.

Recently we found that many devices are out of management,
we need to rearrange all the devices in our network,
including management IP, for the manufacturer, model, device SN, and account password.

So, we need a program to scan the all networks.
Help us get it.

Needs list

  1. Try connecting the device for ssh or telnet.
  2. Can use different password groups to try it.
  3. Get the device manufacturer, model, system name, and device SN.
  4. Result from some information including running information, error, and basic file output.
  5. Give me an excel Database to me to manage and review it.

Code

Using the paramiko module, we program a class to connect the device for ssh.

It can connect devices, try multi-group accounts, and result in some information.
The re module, helps us filter just our needs information.

We create two lists, it save every thread results information.

final use the pandas module will all information save to a CSV file.

Python example code

Scan devices ssh of python code

Beauty Album

entry.title: Python for curl get pictures
entry.content:
Python analyer html code, and download pictures.

Design Logic

  1. Get HTML code with Chrome or Edge or another browser.
  2. Write the code into the file as save a html.txt.
  3. Python opens it and uses the open model to open it.
  4. Uses the re.findall method of the re module to find out what I need, such as title and pictures links.
  5. Create an execution function to download and save the file, and the parameter needs to be passed in as URL.
  6. End we can combine the various modules to use.

Example

entry.title: Python config switch for Django
entry.content:
Python django for web, manage all network device and batch configure and batch check and batch monitor, a Example code

Django install and build

  1. Install the necessary libraries:

You can install the netmiko and pysnmp libraries using pip:

  1. Create a new Django project:
    You can create a new Django project using the following command:

This will create a new directory called myproject with the basic files and directories needed for a Django project.

  1. Create a new Django app:
    You can create a new Django app using the following command:

This will create a new directory called myapp with the basic files and directories needed for a Django app.

  1. Define the models:
    In the models.py file of your app, define the models that will represent the network devices and their configurations:
  1. Define the views:
    In the views.py file of your app, define the views that will handle device management, batch configuration, and batch monitoring:

In this example, the device_list view displays a list of all devices, the device_detail view displays detailed information for a single device, the device_configure view allows you to configure a device with a batch of commands, and the device_monitor view displays the system description for each device.

  1. Define the templates:
    In the templates directory of your app, create HTML templates that will display the device list, device detail, device configuration, and device monitoring pages.

  2. Define the URLs:
    In the urls.py file of your app, define the URLs that will map to the views:

Html Example code.

  1. device_list.html:

  2. device_configure.html:

  1. device_monitor.html:

Authenticatin for Django

To enable web authentication in a Django web application, you can use Djangos built-in authentication system. Here are the steps to enable authentication:

  1. Add the Authentication Middleware:
    In the MIDDLEWARE setting of your projects settings.py file, add the following line:

This will add Djangos authentication middleware to the request processing stack.

  1. Configure Authentication Backend:
    In the AUTHENTICATION_BACKENDS setting of your projects settings.py file, add the following line:

This tells Django to use its built-in ModelBackend to authenticate users against the database.

  1. Create a Login View:
    In your apps views.py file, create a login view that handles the authentication process. Here is an example:

This view checks if the request method is POST, and if so, it tries to authenticate the user with the provided username and password. If the authentication is successful, the user is logged in and redirected to the home page. If the authentication fails, an error message is displayed on the login page.

  1. Create Login Template:
    In your apps templates directory, create a login.html template that displays the login form. Here is an example:

This template extends the base.html template and displays a login form that collects the users username and password.

  1. Protect Views with Login Required Decorator:
    In your apps views.py file, add the login_required decorator to any views that require authentication. For example:

End, directory

Here is a brief overview of each directory and file:

Django deploy

To build a Django web application, you can follow these general steps:

Create a new Django project:

Start Django web service:

Can access the app by opening http://localhost:8000/ in your web browser.

entry.title: Juniper Subscriber IPoE BRAS
entry.content:
Juniper MX Series as BRAS Gateway.

DHCP Subscriber Access Networks Overview

DHCP and Subscriber Management Overview

Juniper overiew

You use DHCP in broadband access networks to provide IP address configuration and service provisioning. DHCP, historically a popular protocol in LANs, works well with Ethernet connectivity and is becoming increasingly popular in broadband networks as a simple, scalable solution for assigning IP addresses to subscriber home PCs, set-top boxes (STBs), and other devices.

The BRAS device terminates the two-layer VLAN, and the access layer device transparently transmits the service VLAN to the aggregation device, and the aggregation device labels the second layer of the stack-vlan

Subscriber Access Operation Flow

The following general sequence occurs during access configuration for a DHCP client:

  1. The client issues a DHCP discover message.
  2. The router issues an authorization request to the RADIUS server.
  3. The RADIUS server issues an authorization response to the router.
  4. The router passes the DHCP discover message through to the DHCP server.
  5. The DHCP server issues an IP address for the client.
  6. The router DHCP component sends an acknowledgement back to the client.
    The subscriber now has access to the network and the authorized service.

Conigure Example

  1. client access dynamic profile

  1. DHCP Server for relay

  2. Radius configure

  3. For Subscriber dynamic profile

  1. Routing and Policy

  2. Verify commands

  1. Example Result

entry.title: Juniper commit confirmed operation notice
entry.content:
Juniper qfx series equiment commit command notice.

Event descript

at last week, a engineer operation the qfx device,
his add device manage firewall policy.

Thats OK nothing, and his use new session login the device, a mouent running commit.

We monioting system, WARNING !!! the device is Down

Login to the core device, and found OSPF status is changed to init.
the device does not have a route, the device is offline.

Fault backtracking

For 1st

The policy is fault, doesnt have permit other traffic, so OSPF status changed to init.

For 2nd

The commit confirmed 1, if 1 min not continue running commit will automatic rollback.
But the time is not enough, the device status is not complete synced, and executed the commit command.

Recommand

Juniper device have very good a feature, thats commit confirmed 1-10, auto rollback.

every commit new command, should setting 3 min later auto rollback.

if not have every trobule, wait 1 to 2 minute and running commit

AI beauty girl

entry.title: Juniper QFX Series Single port multi-business
entry.content:
QFX serise single port mulit-server

The qfx series has certain changes compared with the ex series port multi-service

Our new backbone use Juniper QFX5120 for Build 100G network.
The main business is the wireless network built by the L3 solution and the large layer-2 IPoE network based on QinQ.
In some places where fiber link resources are not available, a single port needs to carry multiple services.

QFX configure for multi-business

FOR EXAMPLE:
The service port is xe-0/0/39, uplink port is ae48.

entry.title: Wiresless Troubleshooting
entry.content:
Wireless AP unable to go online

Tag & categories

tag

categories

Wireless AP unable to go online

The corresponding IP address is not obtained.

Our built new backbone network, needs will old network move it.

Our wireless APs are deployed using the L3 solution and need to obtain addresses through DHCP-Relay. During the relocation process, it was found that some APs could not obtain addresses and go online.

After several packet captures and tests, it was found that the DHCP-Relay source address was not configured, which mainly involved Juniper and H3C equipment. The Ruijie test was normal and no additional configuration was required.

Juniper

add dhcp-relay source

for example
172.30.0.1 is Our DHCP Server

H3C

add dhcp relay source-address

example

Ruijie

WARNING!!! if ruijie device as access switch not get address, recommendation check service dhcp

Appreciation of beautiful pictures
